title: [BUG] Build fails for iossimulator-arm64
body:
**Description**

SkiaSharp's native assets for iOS ships as a `.framework`. This only allow an arch, like `arm64`, to be included a single time. This is a problem now that iOS (phones) and iOS simulators both needs `arm64` _slices_ to build.

Apple's solution is to use `.xcframework`. This allows a single distribution to cover all (Apple) platforms. This allows shipping arm64 support for both iOS and iOS simulators (and many more) from a single package.

**Code**

Build any app using SkiaSharp for the iOS simulator running on arm64 (Apple Silicon)

**Expected Behavior**

A successful build

**Actual Behavior**

```
 DebugMyApp.Mobile -> /Users/poupou/git/uno/uno-debug-test/DebugMyApp/DebugMyApp.Mobile/bin/Debug/net6.0-ios/iossimulator-arm64/DebugMyApp.Mobile.dll
  Optimizing assemblies for size, which may change the behavior of the app. Be sure to test after publishing. See: https://aka.ms/dotnet-illink
  Tool xcrun execution finished (exit code = 1).
          
  ld: building for iOS Simulator, but linking in dylib built for iOS, file '/Users/poupou/.nuget/packages/skiasharp.nativeassets.ios/2.88.3/runtimes/ios/native/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp' for architecture arm64
  clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
  
/usr/local/share/dotnet/packs/Microsoft.iOS.Sdk/16.0.523/targets/Xamarin.Shared.Sdk.targets(1222,3): error : clang++ exited with code 1: [/Users/poupou/git/uno/uno-debug-test/DebugMyApp/DebugMyApp.Mobile/DebugMyApp.Mobile.csproj]
/usr/local/share/dotnet/packs/Microsoft.iOS.Sdk/16.0.523/targets/Xamarin.Shared.Sdk.targets(1222,3): error : ld: building for iOS Simulator, but linking in dylib built for iOS, file '/Users/poupou/.nuget/packages/skiasharp.nativeassets.ios/2.88.3/runtimes/ios/native/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp' for architecture arm64 [/Users/poupou/git/uno/uno-debug-test/DebugMyApp/DebugMyApp.Mobile/DebugMyApp.Mobile.csproj]
/usr/local/share/dotnet/packs/Microsoft.iOS.Sdk/16.0.523/targets/Xamarin.Shared.Sdk.targets(1222,3): error : clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation) [/Users/poupou/git/uno/uno-debug-test/DebugMyApp/DebugMyApp.Mobile/DebugMyApp.Mobile.csproj]
```

**Workaround**

Build as x86_64 and use Rosetta at runtime. Still, it's inefficient, slower and might not work if some other dependencies are not available on x86_64.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue: 2.88.3 (and previous versions)
- Last known good version:  none, not a regression
- IDE:  all
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  simulator builds / arm64 target
